intro: Cayratia longzhouensis, commonly known as the Longzhou climbing vine, is a species native to southern China. It is a climbing plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its twining stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish-white flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are follicles that mature into dry, dehiscent pods containing seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
